text: The Gryta Hydroelectric Power Station () is a hydroelectric power station in the municipality of Rindal in Møre og Romsdal county, Norway.Tre nye kraftverk. 2006. Aftenbladet (10 July).Konsesjon til å bygge Gryta kraftverk. 2006. Byggeindustrien (10 July). It is a run-of-river hydro power station utilizing a drop of in a tributary of the Surna River. Permission was granted for construction in 2006Lillebo, Eirik. 2006. Konsesjon til Gryta kraftverk. Tidens krav (July 10). and the plant came into operation in 2009.Åpning av Gryta Kraft. 2009. Trollheimsporten (8 June). It is operated by Gryta Kraft AS. It operates at an installed capacity of , with an average annual production of about 4.5 GWh. ==See also== ==References== Category:Hydroelectric power stations in Norway Category:Rindal Category:Energy infrastructure completed in 2009
title: Gryta Hydroelectric Power Station
